Description: Study of a single figure for the painting 'Israel in Egypt' (Guildhall Art Gallery, London, acc.no 1014); standing to front with legs spread apart and bending forward, bald and wearing a loincloth Black, brown and red chalk
Curator's comments: The painting was exhibited at the Royal Academy of Arts, London in 1867 (no.434).
Exhibition history: 1983 May-Jul, Brighton AG, 'The Inspiration of Egypt', no. 345 1983 Aug-Sep, Manchester AG, 'The Inspiration of Egypt', no. 345
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Edward John Poynter (L.874; Executors of)
Purchased through: Charles Francis Bell (for Executors)
